It fills them up and keeps them going until the next meal!

My mistake for not spotting the word, "flavored," but this is really awful! I was expecting Blue Mountain coffee and instead got this foul tasting coffee-like brew that has no coffee taste at all. Is it hazelnut? I hope not - I have nut allergies. Whatever it is, it overpowers any weak coffee flavor that may have been present at the beginning!

Checking the ingredients on the package, we learn that it includes Arabica coffee and "natural and/or artificial flavors." Digging around the Wolfgang Puck website, we first learn that it's "Light flavored coffee with the essence of the islands (Flavored)" and finally, "Coconut Infusion Flavored Coffee."

I never would have guessed coconut.

I love this coffee from Wolfgang Puck, it is always fresh, tasty and provides a consistent cup of java, one cup at a time.

Best of all, you can taste the flavors that make Jamaica Blue Mountain coffee so famous. Of course, it is not 100% Blue Mountain, but a respectable blend of arabica beans that includes enough of that treasured bean to justify its name. And it is neither under nor over roasted, just done to the point where the flavors are best.

I bought this for use in my Bunn pod brewer, and since I am unable to buy these pods at the local supermarket, I took a chance at buying a 54 unit package without having tasted the product before.  Just opening the pouch releases a pleasant and sweet aroma.  This coffee is light and balanced, with low acidity.  I quickly went through the first 18 count box.
Jamaica Me Crazy is my new favorite. The aroma alone makes me smile. Unlike most flavored coffees, the taste delivers too. Awesome coffee!
Great tasting coffee.  I use two pods because I like it strong.  Pods fit Senseo coffee maker perfectly.
When I attempted to return this item upon finding it would not work in a Keurig, I was especially disappointed to see that I could not return even the second unopened box.

This has become one of our favorite Keurig flavors. The taste is very smooth and the coconut flavor is not over-powering. We drink our coffee black, and some of the flavored coffees have a strong, almost bitter after-taste when cream and sugar aren't used. This one doesn't have that after-taste. I'm on my 4th reorder, and have started buying the larger boxes so I don't have to do without it.
I have tried other pods and have noticed the added flavors are over-powering and leave a chemical after-taste. The pods without the added flavors taste great. I am a pod fan.

I got this 3 pack because I LOVE Jamaica me Crazy K-cups (which is what I thought these would be). But, regardless, when they arrived and I realized they were pods I thought "Oh well, I can still use them in my Kurig."... But these taste nothing like the K-cups! I mean, NOTHING. ...dirty water. I can't imagine any kind of single cup brewer somehow magically making these things taste good.

wolfgang puck jamaica me crazy coffee makes my mother crazy about coffee so i buy it for her all the time and the best deal for these coffee pods has been on amazon so this is where i get them...good coffee...good price and free ship with amazon...glenn

I was also expecting something more akin to the Green Mountain 'Island Coconut' coffee - an aromatic coffee that tastes like coconut - this is NOT remotely close. Doesn't smell or taste very good and the coconut flavor or smell is almost non-existent. Don't waste your money.

I received a new coffee maker and it has the option to use these coffee pods in the single serving side of the machine..Well decided to try a few varieties to see what might be good and what my guests might enjoy.
Well I am blown away at HOW GOOD this variety, Jamaica Me Crazy tastes... I am not usually a fan of flavored coffee's but this is just enough of a light coconut flavor and scent to make it a nice variation .. This is particularly pleasant as a after dinner dessert coffee with a light amt of cream.. No sugar is really need.. I like the light sweet smell that my cup of coffee give me . Such a pleasant experience..
I will definitely be getting more of this variety and it also inspires me to want to try some others that Wolfgang Puck has as well..
This was very good coffee, enjoy the pod style coffee makers the best. Quick and easy no mess to clean up after.

This coffee was a dollar more than most, but I love coconut flavored coffee and just had to pay the price for "Jamaica Me" to give it a try!

I"m so glad I tried it! It is without a doubt the best K cup of coffee I've ever tried.

Description said flavored, but what kind of flavor?  I purchased, and I did not like the flavor: it had a cinnamon taste to it.  Description should mention the flavor to expect.  Hawaiian hazelnut is very good and subtle.  Works great with my Senseo

I thought I was ordering K-cups since I found this listing in an Amazon e-mail to me about K-cups. The mistake was unfortunate and Amazon made it right by issuing an immediate refund. I just wish I could have found a way to use the "pods" in my Keurig machine because Wolfgang Puck Jamiacan Me Crazy is my favorite coffee of all.  Thank you Amazon for being the best online merchant of all.
I bought these coffee "Pods" to use in my Keurig. Now discover that these are differenct "Pods". Amazon wont't take them back. I am stuck.
I did not know there was a difference between "pods" and K cup coffee.  Very disappointed in the description.  Again, THESE ARE NOT K CUPS!!
This was also Hazelnut just like the K-Cups. This wasn't in the description and smelled awful. It was Wolfgang me crazy.

I was looking for something healthy to replace my horrible addiction to soda. One day at my college, Steaz Iced Teaz were being put into a new healthy vending machine. I asked to try the Blueberry, Pomegranate & Acai flavor because the gentleman said it was his best seller. I certainly know why! The taste is great, it is a very refreshing drink and it has less than half of the calories, carbs, and sodium as a soda. I love this stuff and now I make sure to have it in my house at all times. When I'm going to leave, I bring some with me. I highly recommend Steaz Iced Teaz.

We are overdosing on high sugar (especially high fructose corn syrup, which is bad for your health) foods these days. Americans are experiencing record epidemics with diabetes and obesity. It's about time some companies are coming out with low, or lower sugar beverages (or in this case, with cane juice) to give people a fighting chance with their health. I am also thankful that this product does not contain any artificial sweeteners (which are also bad for your health; please read 'Sweet Deception' by Dr. Joseph Mercola- a phenomenal book). This iced tea tastes very good, without too much sugar overpowering the tea flavor. Excellent product!
Let me start by saying that this is an absolutely fantastic iced tea.  Full of flavor and antioxidants!  Give it a try - only 80 Calories for the entire can!  (40 cals/serving).

I don't know what other teas people are drinking for this review, but for me there is no aftertaste.  It has just the right amount of sugar without being overly sweet.  You really taste the blueberry flavor.  I have stopped drinking sodas and have gone to drinking Steaz teas.  The peach and lime-pomogranate are very good as well.  Try picking one up at  your local grocery store to see if you like it, then go to Amazon and buy by the 12 pack for a better deal.
This tie was some what good but left a bad after tasted. I gave it three star's as that it was not so bad as to make me want to not drink it.

Cans came super dented and messed up but I didn't care about that. The tea tastes like water and sweet n' low with raspberry syrup. Cheap and a decent drink to give guests you don't need to impress but over all not even worth the $1 per can.

I find that most pre-bottled teas are too sugary and for that reason I decided to try these Steaz.  The amount of sugar in these is pretty close to perfect BUT there is barely any flavor in this tea.  Tastes like water with a slight hint of some blueberry taste.  I could understand lowering the sugar but with no flavor I might as well drink bottled water.  ALso the top of every can is stained with spilled tea and covered with dirt, kinda gross and a pain in the ass to have to wash it off before you drink each one.

I was conflicted as to how I was going to rate this item. The product is excellent. No complaints. But I was buying them at $12.66 for a 12 pack, now its about $26 for a 12 -pack. That's super pricey.
My son, who is very picky, loves this drink. I like it because it is not full of sugar and has no sugar substitutes.
These teas are natural, low in sugar and this is the best price you can get them! Dont think twice. They are amazing, so is each and lemon flavors!

sooooooo good.

I love this stuff! not too sweet, just perfect. The Tea came in a jiffy, a 12 pack that cost me about $12 - which is cheap, considering I normally pay $2 each at my local grocer. The ingredients are great and it is a genuinely good product.

Great flavor! Good for afternoon pick-me up. I think this is the best Steaz flavor -- but some of the others ones are good as well.

I subscribe to monthly shipments -- easier and cheaper than picking it up at the store.

I love this stuff!  I'm not a big water drinker I hate to admit.  This tea is a great alternative to pop, juice, etc.  It's not too sweet-just right-so I don't feel bad drinking it.  Flavor is refreshing and not overpowering.
Great taste, good ingredients.  I like it (and I'm picky).  Order came quickly and just about to order some more.
Don't know if its my tastebuds or the taste the drink, but I hate it.  It has a bad taste, like it was sweetened with an artificial sweetener.

The first time I ordered this was to just see if it would be a healthy type drink I could drink every day if I wanted.  I've now been subscribed to it for months.  The drink is very refreshing and has a great taste, all with a reasonable amount of calories.  I am now interested to try other products from Steaz.
I've said the same for the citrus one...I like these.  Nice energy drink replacement.  Not sickly sweet, tastes great, good energy boost!

This one doesnt wow me, but it is tasty and smooth with just enough sweetness. The blueberry/pomegranate blend well and go down easy. Not my favorite Steaz, but definitely still has a place in my fridge. As an aside, this one is my girlfriends favorite, and she gives it five stars, so my household combined ranking would be 4 1/2 stars.
Enjoy!

Steaz Blueberry Pomegranate & Acai green ice tea is fantastic.  It's one of my favorite drinks.  I feel like I'm being healthy by drinking this instead of soda, and the calories are low.  Win win.  Only negative is the cost.  I would drink more of it if the price were less expensive.
These are truly delicious, full of nuts, and the Apricot adds the right amount of sweetness and moistness.  I have tried several different KIND bars, and these are by far my favorite!
Small, easy to take along in my purse.  Great for dip in blood sugar.  Keeps well and doesn't melt in warm temps.  Very good tasting.
I love the mini kind bars.  Sometimes the full-sized bars are too much and these are just right.  I hope they come out with all of the KIND bar flavors in the minis!

I have been subscribing to this and other Kind products for over a year now, and have noticed that the bars are getting smaller and smaller, but the price keeps creeping up.

It have become almost a game when the bars arrive: How much smaller are the bars going to be since the previous consignment of 3 months ago? Maybe I should keep one from each shipment and compare its length when the next arrives.

Of course the wrapper remains the same size, and that just adds to the fun. I wonder if the bar will ever reduce to half the wrapper size.

Apart from all this, the quality of the bars themselves has remained consistent, but the freshness varies from shipment to shipment.

It was my mistake that I did not recognize that these were mini bars.  They are maybe half the size of the bar you find in the store.  I paid $17 for 20 bars.  I now see that they are $25 for the same amount.  unless you need the small bars, i would not recommend buying these.

I ORDERED 4 BOXES OF 5 KIND MINI BARS AND RECEIVED ONLY 4 MINI BARS IN A ZIP LOCK BAG CALLED PACK OF 4. LUCKILY, AMAZON CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS ABLE TO REFUND MY DEFECTIVE ITEM. HOWEVER, I WILL NOT EVER AGAIN ORDER FROM THIS COMPANY AND CANNOT RECOMMEND THEM. THE FOUR KIND MINI BARS I RECEIVED ARE BENT AND NOT AT ALL APPETIZING  UNLIKE THE DELICIOUS KIND MINI BARS I HAVE ENJOYED IN THE PAST. THESE ARE UNAPPEALING SINCE THEY HAD BEEN TAKEN OUT OF THEIR BOX AND PUT INTO A ZIPLOCK TYPE BAG WHERE THEY GOT SMASHED.

I buy Kind bars to stash in my pocket book or bike bag. I am an avid cyclist and need nutrition on the go. I LOVE the variety of Kind bars and I also feel like I am getting to crunch and chew a lot. I am also Gluten Free and Kind products are GF.

I have been eating KIND bars for 4 years now (maybe more) consistantly and recommend to others all the time.

Give them a try, but word of warning - you might get addicted too!
Those fruits and nuts and chewy stuff that hold it all together is a great combo. Addicting. Healthy and gluten-free.....YAY!
Not as good as the almond and coconut.... but still yum!  I love the texture and how clean the kind items are.  I typically use these before and after my workouts.

If you like apricots or peaches this is the energy bar for you.It is completely natural, tasty, not overtly sweet and
the minis are a prefect dessert or snack size.Buying it on Amazon is the best deal I found for these especially with the subscribe and save option.
In grocery stores you are paying close to $22 for the same box.

I ordered the Fruit & Nut mini bars expecting to receive 20 individual mini bars since the description says 5 count pack of 4. However, as some other reviews indicated, what they actually ship you is 1 count pack of 4 - meaning 4 mini bars for the price of $22.xx. I contacted Amazon and they said they could not "fix" the problem but would offer me a full refund instead.

If you are interested in these bars, order the regular size instead (as I did). They seem to be shipping correctly.
I thought cranberry was my fav til I tasted these. Magnificent! Tastes like tropical paradise and very filling. Keeps my from passing out when blood-sugar low. Love that its made with honey.

Be aware, this seller is only fulfilled thru Amazon, not an Amazon product. What was sent was 4 mini bars re-sealed, not a full package.

From the description:"Pack of four boxes, each box contains 5 (0.8-Ounce) bars (total 20 bars, total 16 ounces)" We only got 4 bars removed from the box and repackaged.

The bars are fantastic and I love them but won't get them thru Amazon anymore. Off to REI I go.

I've started working out.  The trainer inists I eat something every few hours and it's hard when I'm at work or traveling.  The workout program includes a nutritionist at no charge. She was adament that I stop using highly processed food bars and move to what she calls "real food" bars. This is the one she recommended and it's delicious.  I used to love another brand of bar that is more "processed" and now that I've been eating these more "real food" items I can barely stand the old stuff.  I love the apricot and the cranberry.  Great food.
These are the very best...but the boxes only contained 4 bars and appeared to have been carefully opened to allow one bar to be removed.  Please check your delivery if you purchase.
kind almond & apricot bars are a 5 star product. But this mini pack is just too $$$ not worth the price, i would just buy the normal size 12 pack.
This is by far my favorite flavor of the Kind Bars!  Great Gluten Free snack when you're on the go!  Delicious!

I've tried a LOT of snack bars. As I become more nutrition-conscious (and wary of additives and HFCS), I have become more particular. And as always, there is the matter of taste.

At this point, Kind bars are all I use. Everything else pales in quality, nutrition, and taste.

Buying from REI in >12qty gets a 20% discount, about a buck-sixty each net, but Amazon (with free shipping) is still better, near a buck-and-a-quarter.

Good for between-meal staying power, bike rides, hikes, emergency car/RV stash. They last on the shelf longer than I have been able to wait to eat them; I can't tell the difference between new bars and > 3-month-old ones from my stash. The dried-fruit content and lower-oil nuts seem to keep them naturally preserved.

I definitely do not like the ones with peanuts in them, but that's a personal taste matter.

Good taste and just the right size, these nutritous gluten free treats are convenient to throw into a carry on bag and snack on anywhere, anytime. They are not messy, nor do they melt, so they travel well year-round.
The coffee is very good compared to Maxwell drip and reasonably good compared to other Tassimo brands. This is my standard morning coffee. No complaints for the cost!

I have purchased these T discs many times and there is something wrong with this last order.  Does anyone else have the problem of the discs only making 3/4 of a cup?  It's not my machine because any other brand turns out fine.  I bought another package from a retail store and the same thing is happening!  For the money that these discs cost, this is unacceptable.  I bought a whole case!!!

the coffee is good. but I've been trying to cancel the auto shipments but its impossible to find any way for customer service to help. therefore they continue sending it and I have to keep sending it back.

This is still good coffee but they have DOUBLED the cost.  Half the price at BBB with a 20 percent coupon.  Also available half what Amazon is now charging @ Target & Walmart (at least it was available there a couple month ago)

For anyone who simply wants a basic, American-style cup of coffee, this is perfectly fine. No, it's not as full-flavored or (arguably) as good as most of the higher priced Tassimo offerings, but it isn't intended to be. This is a simple, inexpensive cup for everyday use.

That said, I knocked off a star due to Amazon's current pricing. The unit price for the "Friday Sale" is roughly the same as the individual retail price at many stores. That's not a deal -- and certainly doesn't represent the sort of discount one would expect to receive when buying a 5-pack.

The coffee is excellent the price great. After my K cup took a dive I gave the T-disc a try Wow. It was better than any of the K-cup brands I had. The only unfortunate draw back is you can't seem to get the T-disc in stores. Good thing Amazon has them at a good price.
I enjoy this coffee.  Biggest problem is that it overfills my mugs so that I have to watch it so as not to overflow. I don't understand why some brands overflow and some do not fill the cup.
I was surprised at the pleasant flavor of this coffee. Robust enough to satisfy, with a great smooth, full taste. One of my regular favorites for the Tassimo.
This coffee is just the right strength for me.  It has no bitter aftertaste.  I love it! Great price with the save & subscribe feature and it comes right to you.

When I come down the stairs in the morning, and the kids are "making coffee" I smell the great aroma of the original Maxwell House coffee that I grew up with. When I get to the kitchen, I have a great cup of coffee, with no mess and no waste. The coffee disc's are expensive, but there is no "day old" coffee left sitting in the pot. This coffee is nothing fancy, not too strong, and taste good every time I fix a cup.
These discs and the Tassimo coffee machine are incredibly easy to use and Amazon ships the discs in record time.

There is nothing really special about these t-discs coffee. It's not very strong, but it does radiate a fresh roasty flavor when brewed. This is definitely the most convenient way for me to brew coffee while in the office where I don't want to deal with the mess of coffee beans.
This is a great tasting product and it is much cheaper than others. You can't beat it in any way. I drank many other coffees including Starbucks and found this to be quite satisfactory.

This Tassimo Maxwell coffee from the Maxwell Cafe collection
is the choice at our house no matter who is choosing! Finally
a coffee that My husband, Kids & friends love! This price can't be Beat!
Great cafe and a good product.. The most you can get for what you pay for love it . thx

This is great-tasting coffee.  So convenient in the T-Disk format.  When you want just one cup of coffee, just pop one of the T-Disks in your Tassimo and out comes a very good cup.  Maxwell House should be proud.

As the title says, this is a good basic cup of coffee.  We feel a little frustrated by the 6 ounce default pour - does anyone still drink coffee in these lilliputian quantities? Still, with a little time spent pressing the "give me more" button, we can get a nice full cup of medium bodied coffee. We generally alternate cups between this and Gevalia Vanilla Hazelnut on the weekends.
The brand of coffee is a nice medium brew.  I don't like coffee that is too bold or strong and this fits the bill.

Do you remember what it smells like to add water to an ashtray full of cigarettes? That's how this coffee tastes. I added a caramel, some hazelnut flavoring, a packet of hot chocolate with miniature marshmellows, and Coffeemate vanilla chai creamer too it. It still tasted bitter, like wet cigarettes and metallic. I think the metallic flavor comes from the t-disc packaging. It doesn't make sense to buy a $100 coffee maker and drink trashy coffee. Especially when you can take that same amount of cash and buy some good coffee. I ignored the bad ratings of other reviewers because I believed the positive reviews. The only redeeming factors are that it is cheaper (less than $7 at Walmart), and that you can make a single cup of coffee. If it were allowed, I'd give it a -5 rating (or <-> -,  for infinitly horrible).

This sauce is made with the hottest pepper in the world. It's named the Naga Jolokia but its' nickname is the Indian Ghost Pepper. I love spicy and I can handle things pretty hot but this sauce really surprised me. The taste is amazing. It's a very unique, heavy flavor that expands and keeps developing and changing in your mouth. Its just delicious. But the heat expands too. I've been putting a minuscule dash on my burgers and other things just to warm things up. So good but really, really, really, really hot.

I try new hot sauces as often as possible and Melinda's has done it again with this particular sauce. It probably goes without saying that this is extremely hot, but what is impressive is that there is an equal amount of flavor. As other reviewers have pointed out, there is a significant difference between a sauce that is just simply chemically hot with extracts and concentrations of capsaicin and one that is naturally hot without the chemical bitter taste you get with some other sauces.

Long story short, this sauce is packed with flavor and certainly packed with heat, it isn't the 'hottest in the world' but if the novelty of insane sauce heat has worn off and you're looking for a flavorful heat, this is for you.

Melinda's hot sauces are the best out there. Very flavorful and reasonably priced. I eat allot of hot sauces and got to tell you all this is one HOT sauce. What is amazing is that there are no "hot pepper extracts" in this. All natural ingredients. There are some flavors that remind me of the Habanero pepper, but this sauce is in another galaxy as far as heat is concerned. I will need to dilute it down or mix it in some BBQ sauce or something, it is that hot. Putting a dime sized drop on a sandwich was tasty at first then the heat comes, and keeps coming. My mouth and tounge hurt for many minutes afterwards, then came the endorphin rush and all was well. Bottom line, if your looking for an all natural hot sauce that is truely hot, look no further.

As a self-proclaimed connoisseur of hot sauces, I would have to say that Melinda's Naga Jolokia is my absolute favorite.  While not as hot as some of the other sauces made form the Bhut Jolokia (Ghost Pepper), it definitely has the best flavor of the ones I've tried.  That said, it is still very hot and there have been times my digestive system has hated me for using too much.  As far as Melinda's sauces go, I would consider this one of the best ones, and as a fan of Melinda's, that's pretty good.  As for heat, I would consider Dave's Jolokia sauce a little hotter, but I'd choose this everytime, just because the flavor is better.  But then again, that's just my opinion. Get both and try for yourself...and get that whole milk ready.

This is no run of the mill hot sauce.  It has instantly become my favorite.  The flavor is complex and satisfying, while the heat seems to gradually build to an intense burn that lingers for a few minutes.  This is not for those who can't handle heat, nor is it for the heat junkies that love the "must sign a waiver to consume" sauces made with capsaicin extract.  If you are someone who appreciates flavor and heat, Melinda's Naga Jolokia is definitely worth trying.

I have to agree with the other reviews. This sauce is very flavorful and by far the hottest Melinda's will ever be able to make. I love Melinda's because they don't try to destroy you with heat, although this one has some SERIOUS kick to it. They really know how to make a flavorful hot sauce, and this one ties with the 4x Reserve as being my two favorites.

THis sauce lives up to its name and the reputation of the Ghost Pepper. It's more than merely hot, though, because it has flavor and
when it's used judiciously, will not overpower the taste of the food. It provides more than augmentation like, say, Tabasco, because the Ghost Pepper is
undeniably hot, and if you use it too liberally no doubt it will render your sauce, your sandwich, your potatoes more molten than you may like.
But a few drops, strategically placed and swirled around, will give you a short burst of intense heat and a lingering taste that, while hot, makes good food
even better. Highly recommended for pepper devotees.
I think it has a better flavor than the Mad Dog ghost pepper sauce, but it isn't as hot.  So, it all depends on what your looking for.

I've reordered this a few times now and love this hot sauce. It is very hot (ghost chilis and all). But unlike a lot of them out there that are just hot and harsh, this actually has a good flavor to it. Assuming your taste buds survive the heat :)

Like most Melinda's hot sauces, they aren't the hottest around. You CAN find hotter sauces made from the same pepper... but whether you taste the pepper is a different story. What I've noticed with this brand of sauce is that you can actually taste the pepper. Now to this particular sauce... I tried dabs of this sauce on omlets or pizza with no particular note or notice. It seemed no hotter than any other habanero based sauce I've had in the past. All hype.. right?

One day I decided to use it for a dipping sauce for french fries... not such a good idea. This sauce is fine in small amounts, you get a good dose of the taste of the pepper. But try to use it like a habanero sauce is a mistake... it's painful. Slow, constant burn really sneaks up on you, just when you think it is not that bad... it's too late. Have respect for the Naga Jolokia!

I really like this hot sauce.  It has excellent flavor and the heat seems to spread through your whole body and stay with you well after you are done eating.  This pepper sauce not only has a unique flavor, it has a unique feel to it.  I'm a fan for life.

I love hot food.LOVE IT! I have finished a bottle of the regular Melinda's and two bottles of the xxxxReserve Habanero Sauce. The Naga Jolokia sauce is hot and delicious.

I was suprised that it wasn't hotter. At first I just tried a dash or two but quickly realized that I could handle quite a bit of it.

Don't be scared by the name, If you like hot food, you'll like this sauce.

I should of bought two bottles of Melinda's and saved on shipping because I have been putting this delicious sauce on everything.  Not as spicy as I thought it would be, but it taste great with a good burn.  It burns much more than any store bought sauce I have tasted.

This hot sauce is GOOD!

I am a chili head with over 30-40 different "active" hot sauces and much more used and in storage. This sauce is one of my favorites. The sauce really works off of the heat and flavor of the ghost pepper and does not try to mask it like many other naga jolokia sauces. It is very spicy though and would only recommend to serious chili heads who like a great heat and great flavor.

Don't let the Naga Jolokia title scare you. This hot sauce actually has a decent heat and decent taste.

Good:

# I enjoyed the taste of it. It doesn't taste like battery acid, unlike some hot sauces.

# Medium-to-hot. Won't be unbearable, even if used in a large amount.

# Perfect to cook with.

# Isn't runny - is actually a paste similar to ketchup.

# I like the design of the bottle

Can't think of anything neutral or bad to say about this product. I would recommend this to anyone.
I love it - plain and simple.  Melinda's has created the best hot sauce EVER!  Painfully hot and flavorful too - how is this possible?  Ballistic all natural heat and delicious, I'm hooked!

I sought this one out because I like Melinda's and I like that it contains peppers, not extracts.

It's good - first jolokia sauce I've tried. I've had a few of Melinda's habanero sauces and like them very much - definitely my favorite brand. But I think Melinda's carrot, etc. blend matches much better with habanero than jolokia - they seemed to clash a little bit. Seems the jolokia overpowered the other flavors rather than blending.

Definitely hot. Worth a try. Melinda's fans may be a bit disappointed.

A very good and very hot sauce...a few drops will do.  Not overly hot like the Dave's Insanity where all they use are extracts.  You actually get some flavor with this one.  It does take some getting used to if you are moving up from Habanero sauces...take it a drop at a time until you develop your toloerance. Once you do, you'll not go back!  I started with a couple drops, and now use this as my go-to sauce of choice on eggs, in chili, on my breakfast sandwich....it's just so good.

Ok...my husband had me purchase this sauce as he is a big pepper fanatic and could not wait to try the Naga Jolokia pepper. He was sorely disappointed in this sauce. We live in the Caribbean and are accustomed to really hot peppers, although I personally am not a pepper person.

After the first tentative taste of this sauce my husband sighed in disappointment and proceeded to literally drench his food in it to get that "eye burning, choking" sensation that apparently all pepper fanatics can't wait to experience.

I have not tried the sauce, but he says that in addition to the heat being just mild to moderate, there is not much flavour there. Anyway, heat level is a subjective and relative thing, so as far as my review goes...thumbs down on expected heat and flavour.

I think his next step is to try the raw naga jolokia peppers. Good luck to him!

I would just like to add to the above review and state that it is now 5 months later and I have since tried the naga jholokia sauce, as my spouse did not seem that impressed. I found it hot and spicy, but nothing that made my eyes water. The heat from the ghost peppers has been tempered with carrots, papaya and passion fruit. Still maintain the 3 star rating.

The #7 ("other" ?!) plastic bowl packaging is supposed to make for microwaving convenience. But I could *taste* that plastic whenever I took a forkful from the edge of the bowl.

Should I be concerned about ingesting plastic that is of the "other" variety? #7 is often polycarbonate, which is often hardened with BPA, which is under fire. And, of course, #7 has no recycling program.

It's hard to know much about the health effects of "other" plastic. Using this container for "heat-and-eat" convenience sits poorly alongside the vigilance involved in choosing organic food! At any rate, the plastic just tastes bad.

I'm still happy to have a case of these at my office so I can make a decent hot lunch without planning ahead -- but I now always dump the contents into a real ceramic bowl, put a small plate over it (to provide a non-airtight lid), and zap it for 60 seconds. (Package recommends 90 seconds, but 60 suffices.) I assume the worst health risk of plastic packaging happens with the microwave heating, and I am happy not to be tasting that "other" stuff.

Minsley, please give us a #1 or #2 recyclable bowl (or #4 bag, or perhaps a #5 heatable bowl) -- and admit that the convenience is just about vacuum-packing the right quantity of cooked rice with the right moisture for re-heating in a proper container -- and then this will become what it should be.
I bought these for my vegetarian daughter when she went off to college and she loves them. A quick and healthy meal! I kept a couple for myself and now I am hooked as well.

This is the best tasting rice!  Much better than any instant rice, and much better tasting than the sacks of frozen rice at the store.  My husband was very skeptical about my praise of gogo rice -- then I made some for him and he LOVES it.  The microwavable pouch rice in the grocery store has an aftertaste -- this does NOT!  It tastes like it came out of the rice cooker.

I am very disappointed and scared.  I love this rice, I love the flavor and the convenience of this product.  However, the forth bowl I cooked in the microwave had a piece of "GLASS" in it!!!  Now I am afraid to eat the rest.  I am lucky I did not swallow it!!!  I heard a crunch when I was chewing and spit it out.  To my dismay it was a piece of clear glass!!!  How the **** did a piece of glass get into the rice.  I would really like someone to cantact me regarding this.  I would contact the product maker, but am not sure how to go about doing that.

As a college student without access to a full kitchen, these make a great snack.  I eat rice on a daily basis at home and the texture of microwaveable rice feels a little off, but the rice itself tastes fine.
These are very nice only take a minute and a half on microwave. I have looked at these and they are pretty reasonable in price.

I eat a lot of chinese food, and always have leftovers. Since it is nearly impossible to reheat rice, I bring my leftover chicken to work with a bowl of GoGo Steamed Rice. After 90 seconds in the microwave, it tastes like freshly steamed rice. Yummy!

Organic, tasty, and right there on the pantry shelf. I love the nutty taste of brown rice but there are those subtle flavors that call for a white rice base. Being a doofus at cooking rice from scratch, I really appreciate having this around to help me out on those occasions.

I reheated this out of the plastic bowl--and even reheated in a ceramic bowl, it tastes like, and smells like, plastic; it leaves a bitter/sour plastic aftertaste for quite a while after it's eaten.

Scaree.

I'm always looking for a quicker way to put together dinner. Thought this would be a good choice -- 1.5 minutes in the microwave, and you have hot rice ready to serve.

Almost.

It comes out kind of sticky and gummy. Taste is OK, but the texture is a little odd. Definitely not "fluffable."

However -- it TASTES great with a saucy topping of some kind. Sauce (doesn't seem to matter what kind) seems to "loosen" the gumminess, and you end up with individual rice grains. I've been using it lately to go with my stir-fries, and the sauce seems to cut through the stickiness, leaving a bowl of very nice-tasting rice. I tried it tonight with a chicken dish and it's great with that, too (3 large chicken breast halves, cut into bite-sized pieces; 2 cans of Sauce Arturo; 1/2 C wine; some chopped onion, sliced ripe olives. Mix sauce, pour over chicken chunks and olive slices in a shallow baking dish, cover and bake at 350 for 40 minutes.)

I'll be buying this again, for sure. I prefer to make rice the "old fashioned way," but this is good when I need something in a hurry.

Just like the other reviewer said- as good as from the rice cooker! Or better!
Just add a little butter (or margarine) and salt.....mmmmm!

This brand of microwaveable rice simply cannot be found in brick & mortar stores (at least not in the Chicago area). I never even heard of it before until I stumbled upon it here- hopefully, Amazon will keep this item, we love it!

These are the best! I absolutely love this rice. So convenient, fresh tasting and perfect portion sized. I throw in some veggies & my favorite asian sauce and I have a lunch or dinner ready in 2 minutes.
do not recommend this.  rice tastes a little odd, maybe the aluminum preservative, or the plastic -- and after cooking in the microwave the kernels are still kind of hard and brittle.

this rice is so good. it's better than I could ever cook, even in a rice maker. it's moist and delicious. it heats up in 1 min 30 sec. it's a good quantity. i put a little soy sauce and sesame seed on it and it's a meal.

Love this product!  This is best tasting instant rice out in the market now.  Takes only 90 seconds and your ready to eat.  The one negative that some people have mentioned is that the container is plastic and when you heat the rice in the plastic bowl, the rice does have a plastic taste and smell to it.  An easy way to avoid this is to just remove the rice from the plastic container before heating it.  I usually put the rice in a ceramic bowl then stick it in the microwave.  Problem solved!

Pros: organic, fast, convenient, tastes good, relatively inexpensive.
Cons: slightly weird texture, plastic taste sometimes, non biodegradable plastic bowl

Details:
I first ordered this as an alternative to Annie Chun's Sticky rice and am really happy I did so. I find it to be a perfect serving for one person, probably 'cos I am of East Indian origin and rice is a staple for us. It is very convenient and not too expensive either. Especially if you compare it with Annie Chun's sticky rice. It doesn't taste like rice you have made in a rice cooker or in a pot on the stovetop, it tastes like rice made instantly in the microwave. The texture is somewhere between that of sticky rice and regular rice. The only thing I don't like is the plastic bowl it comes in, for two reasons: 1. you can "taste the plastic sometimes, especially at the bottom and the sides. 2. it goes straight into the landfill. It would be great if they replace the plastic bowl with some sort of natural/biodegradable material. That's the reason I took off one star, otherwise it is a pretty good product for the price. If you are getting it this rice, I'd suggest doing what I do and what some others here have said, dump the contents in a creamic/glass bowl and follow the instructions on the package to microwave. Bottom line, it is fast, convenient, organic and tastes pretty good. Put it on subscribe and save and get even better value for money.

Great flavor, healthy and tasty, as good as Annies sticky rice but much lower cost
walk in the door and 2 minutes later your eating lunch, Cant beat that
We thoroughly enjoyed the taste of this rice. The grains were long and smelt excellent. On top, this is organically grown rice so free from chemicals and pesticides. Will buy this rice again :)

I love these rice bowls. Older kids can make them by themselves as snacks, which is mainly what we use them for. These aren't as sticky as the Annie Chuns (which we love also), but the better price on these makes GoGo Rice our choice.
Update 10-01-08: I'm so disappointed by the rate hike in the case of these bowls! It used to be such a bargain. I also think the previous poster has a good point re: heating in this grade plastic.
Yummy, smooth and rich dark chocolate. Not too sweet and tastes like very expensive dark chocolate. Perfect finish after a good meal or for a late night snack. Intense and silky.

I was worried that 70% dark chocolate meant very bitter. I was totally wrong. What I found was smooth and sophisticated. A "grown-up" chocolate. The sweetness is very light but just right. Nibble it or just place it on your tongue and let it melt- either way is great.  I sometimes have just one small square and that satisfies my sweet craving. I refuse to spend my money on other brands now.
What's not to love about this delicious chocolate? I have no negative words! I have started eating it for breakfast and can assure you it's an excellent way to start the day!

I've been buying these bars, singly, for years and years at the grocery store. They were out of the black ones, for some reason, so I finally ordered an entire box.

This is my favorite chocolate. It's nice and dark and flavorful without being bitter or waxy. It is the only bar of this richness that I have tried that melts well on the tongue. Everything else this dark seems to just chip, which isn't any good. Chocolove makes the winningest chocolate that I've tried, and their black bar is my old standby.

The gold bar has good flavor, but doesn't melt well. Some of the flavored bars are good. The best is the peppermint (blue). My other favorite is the ginger (green). Can you tell I prefer dark to milk?

If you're interested, it turns out you can send any of these chocolate bars through the mail with only a "forever" and a postcard stamp. They were my valentines this year, wrapped up in colorful paper. These are particularly appropriate for valentines because there is always a love poem on the inside of the paper. I tend to skip the poem and go straight for the treat. Yum!
Yes, what a deal!  Delicious chocolate that is good for you!  Also, this IS the best price you can find for it, even better than directly from Chocolove!!!  Maybe I shouldn't let them know that!

I love many of the chocolove bars, they are all wonderful and full of flavor.  This one is a very simple suttle dark chocolate, not too strong but not lacking in flavor either. If you are a fan of dark chocolate I would give this one a try, its very smooth and coats the mouth in a wonderful soft dark chocolate.  Not sickly sweet at all, but just a touch of sweetness.  The cocoa flavor is perfect here.  Its not my most favorite dark chocolate but it is a nice treat to have to change things up a bit.

This is my favorite dark chocolate...just don't order it in the summer!  It does not travel well, and has a tendency to melt or become discolored in the heat.  (Luckily, Nutricity is fabulous about refunds).

The chocolate bars arrived on time packed with an icebag and in a nice box which makes it easily accessible to get one at a time. It is delicious 70% chocolate which I have had before and am enjoying again. It is a good choice.Chocolove Premium Chocolate Bars, Belgian Chocolate, Strong Dark (70%), 3.2-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)
This chocolate is high-quality chocolate. It isn't too sweet, and the taste is extraordinary. It is by far the best I've ever had (and I've had a lot)!
I love this chocolate!  I usually buy it at Whole Foods, but they were out for a couple of weeks so found it here.  It was quite a bit cheaper on Amazon.

Sent these bars to both of my older kids as birthday presents with a note that this chocolate, eaten in moderation, could be consumed without guilt because dark chocolate is actually good for you!  Both kids loved the bars so now I guess I need to send some to myself!
I bought this as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend's mother. Not only was she quite pleased with the taste, but I was also surprised at the amount that was there. I would definitely recommend.
Singing the praises of healthy DARK CHOCOLATE, with in moderation of course, is good for a person.....Get away from the unhealthy milk chocolate and try this..... I'm hooked!
This product is very high quality, the chocolate flavor is consistent, and it is smooth all the way through swallowing, without any bitter after taste whatsoever!

These taste awesome. And I'm not a nutrition expert but they seem pretty healthy too, pretty low in sugar etc. I give this when I have women over (I'm a single bachelor) and they love it. It looks far more expensive than it is, and the poem on the inside of the label is a nice touch. I'll definitely be getting more when my current supply runs out (which will be soon at the rate I pick up women lately... haha).

I bought this because of the supposed health benefits. Was concerned that the 70% cocoa would have a bitter taste.
Not so. Very smooth and delicious. Great that something that tastes this good is healthy too!

While the chocolates from Chocolove may be tasty, their treatment of folks they do business with is anything but. I shop and support small business because I believe them to be responsible to other small businesses they work with. When the management of Chocolove refused to pay for work done for them by friends of mine (also in Boulder), I can no longer buy their chocolate. There are many other small chocolate companies around and from now on my money will go to folks who do the right thing.

If you are purchasing a box of Norman Love "chocolates" because they are pretty and artistic, you will probably get a box of creams.  They are NOT chocolates.  They have a thin candy coating that has a far-distant vague taste of chocolate, but it is overcome by the fruity cream in the middle. They may sell chocolate "bars" but I will never find out because their customer service is hateful and demeaning.  If you want a REAL artisan chocolate experience, order Christopher Elbow instead.

I just bought the toffee and almond bar.  It was the worst chocolate I've ever eaten in my life.  It tasted waxy.  The toffee was basically non-existent. I searched the bar for almonds and found a couple of tiny pieces.  I threw it away after only eating 2 small squares.  What a waste of money.  And my taste buds are very disappointed.  Maybe the dark chocolate is better but I definitely do not recommend this one.

All Annie Chung bowls are delicious, without a doubt. I believe everything to be in the perfect state of consistency, the sauce is neither too thick nor too thin, the noodles the perfect thickness. The flavor is actually not the typical Pad Thai flavor as you would get at a chain restaurant such as Pei Wei. It is again the perfect amount of flavor, just as the rest of the elements are well proportioned.
However, as ALL ready-made dishes are, this is full of sodium. I believe this dish to be on the healthier end of the ready-made noodle spectrum. You will get a heartier meal out of an Annie Chung bowl than out of any ramen package. It is far healthier than instant Yaki-soba which follows a bit of the same preparation tactic (freeze-dried veggies, etc.).
Basically, this is a very nice occasional treat. Tastes are discriminating, but I do really enjoy this bowl.

The good: This stuff is really well packaged and easy to make in the office. It comes in a biodegradable microwave-safe bowl, which is pretty awesome.

The bad: It tastes nothing like pad thai.

The ugly: It tastes awful, I don't know they managed to do this using natural ingredients - but it tastes very unnatural and leaves a lingering aftertaste. It will also help you continue on your way to hypertension and that first heart attack by giving you 60% of your sodium RDA in every bowl!

Annie Chun's Pad Thai Noodle Bowl is EXCELLENT! With its savory sauce and peanut topping, it's a way to enjoy the taste of Thailand in your own home. It's easily made (only 2 minutes in the microwave) However,it does need extras. Stir fry some tofu,veggies,or something like that to make it heartier. It could also use a squeeze of fresh lime like the original recipe. As usual, Annie Chun brings a taste of Asia to your kitchen!

Nasty. Absolutely NASTY! I can still smell it and I wish I couldn't. I only put a few drops of the sauce in because I hated the way it smelled, but I was still willing to give it a try because some great tasting things can smell bad.

Nope... it was just as bad as it smelled. Extremely unnecessarily powerful flavor... kind of like drinking soy sauce and salt together. I guess someone might like it if their taste buds are numb.

I will never touch another Annie Chun's product again because of this experience. I don't think their taste testers have my tastes because that was nasty to the EXTREME!

If you buy this, then good luck.

I've tried 6 other Annie Chun's noodle flavors. Some I really liked and others just needed some meat added to taste yummy. But for this one, adding meat nor minimizing the amount of sauce didn't do anything to alter the awful sour taste. Please improve on the sauce.
flavor is okay but total product is disappointing, too many noodles, no veggies, high calories

Pad thai is the first thing I order at any thai restaurant. It varies depending on the restaurant, but I've always know it to have a tangy peanut sauce that's slightly sweet.

However, these noodles just don't taste anything like any of the pad thai dishes I've had. It's also just not very good. The first thing I noticed upon opening the noodles packet was the unnatural smell it emitted. I tasted the noodles plain, and they were very noticeably sour with another unnatural note (detergent... perhaps). I know I did not get an expired package because every Annie Chun's bowl I've had was just like this. And they were all a year or two from expiration.

I thought it might get better when I blended in the flavorings, but it didn't improve. Very sour, as if the noodles were seasoned primarily with vinegar. I gobbled them up because I was very hungry at the time, but they were not all that good. They're not very unpleasant, but they could be much better. Though, one nice thing about these is that they're very generous on the noodles, so they fill you up (they left me very satisfied even though I had been famished when I was making them).

You also might want to consider that they have strong green onions. My boyfriend had to admit to me (trying not to sound harsh) that they made my breath smell of onions hours afterwards. We're close enough that we don't get embarrassed by things like that, but you that you might not want to have this in the office.

Even after reading the reviews I went ahead and made an order.

The Good-- for something that is a packaged and pre-cooked off the shelf product, I would say it's pretty good. If you're used to eating Ramen Cup-o-Noodles, hands down Annie Chun wins.

The Con-- Sure this doesn't taste just like the Pad Thai from a restaurant. I would say you have to be an idiot to expect any product/brand like this to offer a 1:1 experience. This product contains no meat or tofu.

An extra note : I started out by buying these from Food Pyramid. When I got my first order from Amazon I noticed the bowl was engineered differently. Once I opened it, I noticed the sauce looked different also. The taste was different. It had more of a peanut flavor and I would say it was more of a mild plus, rather than a mild on the heat index. The rest of the ingredients were the same. I wanted to know why it was different. The packaging looked the same. At first I thought... Oh Amazon is just selling secondary product. I thought maybe the factor screwed up and sold it to Amazon on the cheap. Then I looked closer and saw something interesting. [...] - The package from Food Pyramid was labeled as Annie Chun, Inc. The one from Amazon was labeled JP Foods, Inc. Both had relatively close expiration dates, so I'm not sure what going with that. Did Annie Chun sell out to JP Foods? I don't know, but for a product that had the exact same package design, it was not the same item.

These convenience noodls are microwaveable, fast to make, can be done in an office or while camping and are all natural with no preservatives or MSG. I'm a big fan of them. I keep a store of these at work for when I just don't have time to go to lunch but I want something hot and soothing.

I've said right up front, these do not taste like Pad Thai. Not exactly. But they taste GOOD. Your restaurant pad thai is going to have a more savory, tangy sauce, there are fresh toppings such as lime wedges, mung bean sprouts, cilantro, and Thai basil. Of course, you get none of that in this package. But for what these are, they taste good. There is a paste-like sauce in a packet, a dry packet of peanut chunks to dust on top, and the usual round wheat noodles. You reheat the noodles in water, drain it off then add the sauce, the peanuts and you are good to go.

If you want to make it more tasty, you COULD add some lime juice, some cilantro, even some bean sprouts, but if you are eating noodles from a packet, chances are you don't have fresh ingredients to hand. So, enjoy these for what they are, savory, tangy noodles and do not imagine House of Siam in your mind's eye (tongue, whatever.)

Why? Because the noodles come SOFT, sealed in plastic! If you are tired of noodles that "crunch" or that have to be reconstituted out of the original cardboard, you are in for a treat! Available in something like a dozen different varieties, try them all and then subscribe to your favorites in order to get the lowest price.

Note: The seasoning comes in a sealed pouch so if you tend to prefer yours less salty or less strong in taste, don't use it all to start. You can always add more in later.

Note: Since the bowl is made partially from cornstarch, it will biodegrade completely so toss it in the trash when you're done without feeling guilty. (For this reason you should NOT attempt to reuse this bowl like you may have done with other brand instant noodle meals that came in plastic bowls.)

I just ate one of these for lunch today and I thought it was awesome.  I went online to find more and I'm surprised it got such bad reviews.  I really liked it and I live in NYC where I eat pad thai and other foods enough to have some point of reference.  I thought it was pretty good.  The only thing I would do is add extra noodles if you're making it at home because I thought the sauce and spices were quite strong and could have been spread amongst more noodles.
I tried, I really tried to eat this.  I've eat her spicier food and was pleased.  I threw this out after a couple of bites.  It tasted like vineger and stale peanuts.

I saw an add on TV for these and then read some reviews on the net (some good some bad). I bought a case of these and wish I hadn't. The sauce tastes terrible (vinegary) and the noodles look, feel, and taste like plastic. Let's be honest here, this IS a crappy microwaveable lunch so I wasn't expecting anything great. I was still EXTREMELY disappointed. I have no idea how a product like this is out on the market. Didn't they do any panel taste tests?

I fed my garbage disposal this stuff after taking a couple bites of it myself. It promptly unhooked itself from the bottom of my sink and jumped out of a third-story window, finding a brutal end on the stones below.

I read all the reviews, but still wanted to give this a try. I love all of Annie Chun's soup bowls and really, really wanted to like this too. However, it was horrible! It smelled up the whole office and was so bad, I was embarrased. I bought a bunch of them, but they are going straight into the trash.

This is an instant noodle dish which you can whip up in 90 sec.  Compare to other instant foods, Annie Chun's foods are the best.  You think it has too much salt?  Add only half the sauce.  How much salt do you think there is in your cheese burger?  Not enough Thai flavor? Come on.  This is an instant food.  If you want real Thai flavor, either you have to make it yourself fresh or go to a Thai restaurant.  One poster said that she saute vegetables and shrimps with the sauce before she adds the noodle.  I'm going to totally copy her idea.  Yum!

I don't know what this is supposed to be but it tastes truly awful. If I was served this in a restaurant, I'd be running for the door. It looked unappealing when I opened up the pack and it totally lived up to it's looks. I ate it because I was hungry and I'd paid for it - but it wasn't a pleasant experience at all. Nothing like any Pad Thai I've ever eaten.  It tasted of what I imagine old cardboard to taste like. Ugh!

I absolutely love Pad Thai. It is one of my favorite dishes and I have eaten it in several Thai restaurants and although the variations are slightly different, it is always delicious. I have been trying to find Pad Thai in a box that I can heat up quite easily and eat it quickly, since I do not have time to go to the Thai restaurant in my city all the time! However, every single time I've tried Thai food in a box, it is nasty. This is no exception.

One weird thing is that the noodles already felt damp when I opened the package. And then I opened the sauce packet....oh, I just about lost my appetite then. Pad Thai does NOT smell like that!!! It smelled similar to soy sauce, but worse. And then I tasted it...the taste was not any better and the aftertaste is even worse.

Don't waste your money on this. I'm never trying Pad Thai in a box again.

i'm gonna keep this short and sweet

Tastes like play-doh, if you like to eat play-doh.. BUY THESE NOODLES, you won't be dissapointed.

Update: decided to eat real play-doh after trying to eat these noodles. the play-doh tasted better.
The coffee is very good compared to Maxwell drip and reasonably good compared to other Tassimo brands. This is my standard morning coffee. No complaints for the cost!

I have purchased these T discs many times and there is something wrong with this last order.  Does anyone else have the problem of the discs only making 3/4 of a cup?  It's not my machine because any other brand turns out fine.  I bought another package from a retail store and the same thing is happening!  For the money that these discs cost, this is unacceptable.  I bought a whole case!!!

the coffee is good. but I've been trying to cancel the auto shipments but its impossible to find any way for customer service to help. therefore they continue sending it and I have to keep sending it back.

This is still good coffee but they have DOUBLED the cost.  Half the price at BBB with a 20 percent coupon.  Also available half what Amazon is now charging @ Target & Walmart (at least it was available there a couple month ago)

For anyone who simply wants a basic, American-style cup of coffee, this is perfectly fine. No, it's not as full-flavored or (arguably) as good as most of the higher priced Tassimo offerings, but it isn't intended to be. This is a simple, inexpensive cup for everyday use.

That said, I knocked off a star due to Amazon's current pricing. The unit price for the "Friday Sale" is roughly the same as the individual retail price at many stores. That's not a deal -- and certainly doesn't represent the sort of discount one would expect to receive when buying a 5-pack.

The coffee is excellent the price great. After my K cup took a dive I gave the T-disc a try Wow. It was better than any of the K-cup brands I had. The only unfortunate draw back is you can't seem to get the T-disc in stores. Good thing Amazon has them at a good price.
I enjoy this coffee.  Biggest problem is that it overfills my mugs so that I have to watch it so as not to overflow. I don't understand why some brands overflow and some do not fill the cup.
I was surprised at the pleasant flavor of this coffee. Robust enough to satisfy, with a great smooth, full taste. One of my regular favorites for the Tassimo.
This coffee is just the right strength for me.  It has no bitter aftertaste.  I love it! Great price with the save & subscribe feature and it comes right to you.

When I come down the stairs in the morning, and the kids are "making coffee" I smell the great aroma of the original Maxwell House coffee that I grew up with. When I get to the kitchen, I have a great cup of coffee, with no mess and no waste. The coffee disc's are expensive, but there is no "day old" coffee left sitting in the pot. This coffee is nothing fancy, not too strong, and taste good every time I fix a cup.
These discs and the Tassimo coffee machine are incredibly easy to use and Amazon ships the discs in record time.

There is nothing really special about these t-discs coffee. It's not very strong, but it does radiate a fresh roasty flavor when brewed. This is definitely the most convenient way for me to brew coffee while in the office where I don't want to deal with the mess of coffee beans.
This is a great tasting product and it is much cheaper than others. You can't beat it in any way. I drank many other coffees including Starbucks and found this to be quite satisfactory.

This Tassimo Maxwell coffee from the Maxwell Cafe collection
is the choice at our house no matter who is choosing! Finally
a coffee that My husband, Kids & friends love! This price can't be Beat!
Great cafe and a good product.. The most you can get for what you pay for love it . thx

This is great-tasting coffee.  So convenient in the T-Disk format.  When you want just one cup of coffee, just pop one of the T-Disks in your Tassimo and out comes a very good cup.  Maxwell House should be proud.

As the title says, this is a good basic cup of coffee.  We feel a little frustrated by the 6 ounce default pour - does anyone still drink coffee in these lilliputian quantities? Still, with a little time spent pressing the "give me more" button, we can get a nice full cup of medium bodied coffee. We generally alternate cups between this and Gevalia Vanilla Hazelnut on the weekends.
The brand of coffee is a nice medium brew.  I don't like coffee that is too bold or strong and this fits the bill.

Do you remember what it smells like to add water to an ashtray full of cigarettes? That's how this coffee tastes. I added a caramel, some hazelnut flavoring, a packet of hot chocolate with miniature marshmellows, and Coffeemate vanilla chai creamer too it. It still tasted bitter, like wet cigarettes and metallic. I think the metallic flavor comes from the t-disc packaging. It doesn't make sense to buy a $100 coffee maker and drink trashy coffee. Especially when you can take that same amount of cash and buy some good coffee. I ignored the bad ratings of other reviewers because I believed the positive reviews. The only redeeming factors are that it is cheaper (less than $7 at Walmart), and that you can make a single cup of coffee. If it were allowed, I'd give it a -5 rating (or <-> -,  for infinitly horrible).

I had to put my son on a gluten free diet, but had a hard time finding an alternative carb source for him.  He refused any of the gluten-free oatmeals I cooked or rice breads.  He was use to his Quaker apple cinnamon instant oatmeal, and this is very similar in texture and taste.  I just add a couple spoonfuls of natural applesauce to sweeten it more, and he eats the whole bowl.  If you are looking for an alternative to the Quaker instant oatmeal packs, this will work out great for you.  My child is super picky, and this past the test with flying colors.

I had been very disappointed to have to give up oatmeal cereal when I had to go to a gluten-free diet, so I jumped at the chance to try this out.  It comes in microwavable packets and is great tasting.  It makes me appreciate breakfast again and is so good that I am getting ready to order my next shipment so I don't run out.

Have a delicious day! Wish I wrote that but it's off the box.So is this "We make glutenfree delicious..it's what we do" and boy did Glutenfreeda do it again.I've been hooked on Glutenfreeda products since they introduced their frozen cookies years ago. I was delighted to see them come out with instant oatmeal and I wasn't disappointed.I was doubly delighted to see the oatmeal offered on Amazon.com. Win,win! When you read the ingredient list you will see why- Off the Maple Raisin with Flax box :certified gluten free oats, raisins, organic maple sugar,brown sugar , flax meal and salt.That's it and yes you read the ingredient list correctly.Real ingredients for my real family.I was very happy to see a very low sodium content and the addition of flax.

I always have a packet with me for a quick snack or those "eat at the desk" lunches. My husband who is not on the gluten free diet loves this oatmeal.He says the oats taste fresher. And for my Celiac college student this product has made his life so much easier.He can have a healthy breakfast in his dorm room or at the food court with no worry of cross-contamination.Like me he always has a packet in his backpack for snacks or a quick lunch.

Thank you Glutenfreeda!

My dogs liked the taste of this food just fine, although they didn't go crazy for it. (I purchased it for a dog who was very thin and needed to gain weight.)

The ingredient list of this food sounds great-- no corn or other indigestible grains, and lots of great healthy vegetables, fruits, and carbs in addition to high quality meats and probiotics. There are NO yucky "meat by-products"-- just meats and meat meals you can feel good about. Unfortunately this food has a higher than normal fat and protein content. Very high protein (minimum 32% in this food) may not be a good choice for every dog (this is especially a concern for older dogs). The fat percentage (minimum 18%) may great for working dogs and active dogs, but the average American couch potato dog could pack on pounds with that much fat unless you increase exercise and/or reduce your portion size (and that may lead to a dog who doesn't feel full/stays hungry).

If your dog is already overweight you would probably want a food with one-third the fat of this product. If you decide to use this food I think it would be a good idea to monitor your dog's weight carefully to avoid having weight gain sneak up on you and your best pal. I am skeptical of dog foods which claim to be perfect for all life stages, too-- puppies and 15 year old dogs can survive on the same foods, but that doesn't mean the same foods are ideal for each dog.

You might want to compare this with similar high-quality holistic foods such as Blue Buffalo Chicken & Brown Rice Adult Dog Food, 30 lbs. or Wellness Super5Mix Chicken Dry Dog Food (30-lb bag) (there are several great Wellness varieties) or Nutro Natural Choice Ultra Adult Dog Food- net wt. 35 lbs. (there are several varieties of Nutro Ultra, too). These foods have the same high quality human grade ingredients, but appear to have a little bit lower protein and fat profiles.

Wondering if your dog is overweight? An easy way to tell is to look down at your dog while it is standing. Viewed from overhead, you should see a definite "waist" narrowing in front of the back legs. Another easy test is to feel the dog's ribs. You should be able to easily feel slight dips between the ribs-- if you can't they are covered with a layer of fat (of course, prominent ribs mean your dog is too thin).

Wolf Chili with Beans, 15-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24)

I know that there must be some percentage of some kind of additional hotness that will make it perfect, but I haven't found it yet. Something to look forward to.

There was no packing around the sides of the case, so this chili was sliding around in this box and tearing the box up. A few of the cans were dented, but no problem there. I am surprised UPS even accepted the package the way the case was sliding around in the box. Ok, enough of that. On to the chili itself.

I bought this because I had read so many reviews about how Wolf chili is supposed to be the best. Well, I gotta say that it doesnt even come close to the best. First of all, open the can and pour it into the pot. Thats right, pour. The consistency of this chili is almost like soup. Any other can of chili you would either have to shake vigorously out of the can or spoon it out, but this stuff just pours out. And I think there was beef in it, but it must have been ground up so small that it was hardly noticable, again, adding to that watery consistency.

As for the taste, well, it aint bad, but again, nowhere near the best. But the consistency of the chili and the taste combined? Makes you wonder how anyone can rave about this stuff. 4/10 at best, and thats being kind.

If you want the best, I would go with Stagg. Many different flavors and a much higher quality, and better consistency.

UPDATE...A week later I ate another serving, only I ate the whole can instead of only ten ounces....8 hours later my body was forced to regurgetate it. This has not happened to me since I ate some really greasy spicy chicken wings for lunch at work in 1993. I spit it into a paper towel, it was orange grease, I fear the same orange grease that rises to the top of most other canned chili's that I am able to mostly skim-off This chili showed very little solid grease at the top, I could not quickly remove it, so I didn't. I suspect it had just as much but was emulsified into the thicker sauce, which I ended up eating and then regurgitating because my body could not digest it. I wish I hadn't eaten it. Now I have 22 cans more which I will be afraid to eat unless I can figure out how to easily get rid of some of the hidden grease.

Enjoy!

Not as good as REAL gravy, but close!

Hain's brown gravy is the perfect storm of accomplishments you don't normally associate with vegetarian food. It tastes like the real thing; it's easy to make; it's inexpensive (~$1 a pack); and it's relatively easy to find: my local grocer carries it - but if yours doesn't, it's also lightweight and easy to ship.

"Savory" and "hearty" are two of the harder-to-come-by tastes in the vegetarian palette, and there's nothing to remedy that dearth like a big bowl of mashed potatoes and gravy. Plus, it's satisfyingly gloppy. Few vegetarian foods promise such delightful slop and unhealth. (The gravy is in truth disappointingly healthy, but you can pretend.)

(Hain's chicken gravy is acceptable but not as successful, though, so watch it.)
To make this less salty (as gravies tend to be), we add one extra cup of water, a tablespoon of corn starch, plus herb seasoning. One visitor licked the plate.....

Whole Kernel Rye
Water

Oat Kernels
Barley Kernels
Linseed
Salt
Oat Fibre
Sesame
Yeast

It is mentioned underneath the ingredients list that this bread containes Sesame. Obviously, some people are allergic to sesame. And, perhaps, some of the other ingredients? Anyway, the ingredient list is above...and, of course, on each loaf wrapper.

No preservatives
Kosher = K parev
High Fibre
Cholesterol Free
Natural Ingredients
Long Shelf Life
Wheat Free

The second-to-the-last attribute, "Long Shelf Life" is due to the fact that THIS BREAD IS PASTEURIZED. I try not to each a lot of processed food, but occasionally I indulge. These are the very best cheese crunchies and gluten free too! I have found these at New Seasons in Portland Oregon every once in a while, but wish they were more readily available. Very good!!!!
The best cheese curl we've found, but we stopped looking once we found these!  Did not think we could consume a case - but, we've back for more.

My local grocery store had to stop carrying these because the distributor dropped them. I tried other stores with no luck. These are the only cheese curls that really taste like cheese and don't taste like you're licking salt. I'm so glad I still have a source to get them.
Addictive. IMHO these are simply THE best cheese curls. I used to get them at a local whole foods market. Ordering by the case is a wee bit cheaper, oh-so-convenient and terribly dangerous.

I tried many times to find a replacement for Planters Cheeze Curls (now they discontinued it). And I think that is a perfect replacement. May be not only perfect but better than original from Planters. So, there is lot of cheeze powder on it and size is right and it's so delicious that when you'll put one curl in to you mouth you will involuntarily draw the next two.

I'll recommend it for everyone who loved old time Planters Cheeze Curls - it's good and probably better.

P.S.: I love them so much so I order them to Russia - total cost with delivery is about 75 dollars!

I'm a secret Cheeto addict, but these baked cheese curls are even more flavorful and addictive than the original.  And they are healthier, which makes them the perfect snack. No artificial cheese flavor, excellent crispy texture and sharp cheese taste.  I'm on my third case now and will continue to order this gem of a snack.  Worth a try if you love cheese curls.

I found this brand of cheese snacks at a Whole Foods store in Manhattan and I've been hooked ever since. Unfortunately, WF started carrying their own brand of cheese puffs and stopped selling Michael Season's. Thank goodness for Amazon.com!

I like these so much that I ordered a case and had them delivered to my office. Now all my office mates are getting hooked. These taste amazing for being "lite", and they have a decent amount of fiber per serving (and relatively low fat/calories). They are all natural, and highly addictive!

I've tried the regular variety of Michael Season's Cheese Puffs, and I do not recommend them because they're too rich. The Lite variety taste perfectly cheesey without being too buttery in flavor.

Makes an awesome afternoon snack!

Because this thing is sooo sinfully delicious, any eater is very likely to go through the entire pouch (contains maybe 7-8 joined cashew pieces) in one sitting. And that, according to the nutritional information printed on the back, equals about 940 calories and almost 66 gms (100% of R.D.A.) of total fat and 11 gmss (66%) of saturated fat. My point is this is not a healthy food by any meaning of that word. Also, each pouch has about 22 gms of sugar, which is why I gave it only 4 stars. I think it still would have tasted just as good without that sugar.

That said, it is still better than eating most junk snacks that are laden with god knows what and how many artificial abominations. The thing I like the most about this cashew product is it is dry roasted, unlike most brands you find on the supermarket shelves which are fried in oil. Nuts are naturally oily/fatty; there' s no need to deep fry them in oil again. Besides, I think nuts taste better in their raw forms.

Finally, I think the label in the package is a little misleading. It reads the product is "Vegan, cholesterol-free, dairy-free, and wheat- free." But, isn't that self-evident? It's like saying bottled water is fat and sugar free.
Great taste.  I especially like the bite-sized pieces that didn't crumble like peanut brittle and make a mess.

Mrs. May's cashew crunch has saved me from eating a whole bag of chips many times!  All I need is a couple of squares of crunch and I'm good to go!  It satisfies my sweet/salty/crunchy cravings all in one and is delicious to boot!
Really good snack. My kids favorite so far. Also, my child with braces can eat these snacks as they are soft enough for her without breaking brackets.

I love this product.  It's so tasty and crunchy.  This is really the best cashew crunch I've ever tasted probably because it's dry roasted and not loaded with sugar.  Great snack - very difficult to just eat a few pieces.

Definitely worth the money.  Unfortunately, they are quite addicting.  These nuts are the best thing since sliced bread.  I am so hooked on them. I actually have to fight myself so that I don't order another dozen bags.
I almost wish it wasn't possible to order these in such a large quantity.  Oh well, sometimes sacrifices need to be made.
The Cashew Crunch is a very tasty snack.  The flavor of the cashews is not destroyed with a lot of other ingredients.  I love that they are all natural with no artificial colors or flavors.

I first found these in a natural foods store. This deal on Amazon is great...I am on a scheduled delivery and get a discount and free shipping. Can't beat that!
I use this snack when I make my own trail mix. I bring it everywhere I go, and the Cashew Crunch always goes first. Not too much sugar. There are other varieties, but I keep coming back to this one.
This is my favorite snack.  Pricy, but other than that, a good experience all the way around.
I love this product. Crunchy and sweet but not too sweet. Can't get enough. Only negative is it is very hard to stop eating and you can go through a bag in no time.
I highly recommend this snack food.  It's a healthy alternative to chips.  It's crunchy and flavorful.  I trust the Mrs. May's brand as they are consistently good.

If you suffer from Celiac, you know that yummy treats are expensive.  There are many flavors that Mrs. May offers, and because they are essentially all nuts, it does not take much to have a satisfying snack or treat after a meal, at a great price.  Also, I am very sugar-sensitive and these fit in well with not disrupting my levels.
Mrs. May's is a great snack.  Healthy and delicious.  Not much in it--simple and yummy.

I loved Mrs. May's Cashew Crunch. What I didn't love about it was the nutritional information. The pieces it is cut into are very small. They are easily popped into the mouth and in a crunch or two they are gone. So consuming the entire pouch is VERY easy to do! ONE OUNCE of this has 172 calories! 12 grams total fat (2 grams Saturated Fat)! Once ounce is gone so quickly that you'll easily overdo it. This snack may be made with healthier ingredients than the garbage you can buy at the local store but it is in no way healthy to eat this snack. I love it but I'll never eat it again.
Thse are one of my most favorite munchies! Nothing but to healthy stuff in there. Better than generic boring granola!

This product is made in China. I would not believe any claims they make regarding allergy safety and vegan/kosher. Considering Mrs. May's markets itself as a healthy product, I was shocked when I glanced at the back and noticed this product was made in China. China has proven that we can not trust their manufacturing practices. Unsafe toys, dog food, and now we're supposed to trust them making our health food?

Not to mention the carbon footprint created by shipping something halfway around the world. I will not buy this product anymore.

I would rather purchase the Sahale snacks that are made in the US, even if they are a bit more expensive.

I was a Mrs. May's regular for years.  I ordered a case of their cashew crunch directly from them and it arrived in a box that said:  Made in China.  I wrote them and, to give them credit, unlike most American companies today, they responded honestly and without the typical excuses. They told me they'd produced their products in China for years with no problems.  My dogs were affected by the Chinese dog food poisoning incident and I did not want to subject my family to the possibility of tainted food purchased in the belief I was giving them something healthy. Also, the fuel used to ship these from China to the U.S. makes them less than viable candidates for sustainability. I already work very hard to ensure than things purchased on Amazon come from areas near my home.
This is so good I wish it comes in a bigger package!
